title: Coordinator, Content - Korea
overview: The Coordinator, Content - Korea position at Netflix is a demanding and fast-paced role that involves tracking and evaluating incoming material, managing content submission, coordinating with departments, conducting market research, and increasing operational efficiency.
description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with 238 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. With this international expansion and a move into International originals, it's a great time to join Netflix. 

The Opportunity
We are seeking a Coordinator, Korean content (Film & Series) based in Seoul, Korea.
The successful candidate will be self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities, with a strong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail. This is a demanding and fast-paced role with growth potential that requires curiosity and significant initiative. She/he will report to the Director of the Content Team in Korea.

extras.title: Responsibilities:
content: Track and evaluate all incoming material (including pitches, scripts, books, etc) and provide recommendations for Film & Series
Managing the process and flow of content submission
Acting as a liaison with various departments (Content Ops, Marketing, PR, Legal, Product) to coordinate information sharing and address incoming requests
Tracking title schedules and key dates for delivery, payments, start dates, options, etc
Maintaining flexibility and openness to take on additional projects as necessary or assigned

extras.title: Qualifications:
content: Min. 3-5 years of experiences to work in the film/series industry
Demonstrates good judgment and strong critical thinking skills
Experience working with international vendors and reviewing/maintaining their accounts, as well as reviewing and executing licensing contracts
Proven communication skills; must be articulate and professional both in written and verbal form
Ability to work proactively, independently and reliably under tight timeframes in a fast-paced environment
High level of organization, detail orientation and ability to time-manage across multiple deadlines
Highly collaborative, resourceful, quick thinking and curious with great calm
Research and analytic experience is a plus
Fluency in English and Korean is required
